intro: Cacalia sericea, commonly known as silky cacalia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Cacalia sericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting pollinators and providing habitat for various insects.
